meanings.definition: To make a low, feeble, whining sound.
meanings.sent1: The puppy whimpered when it missed its owner.
meanings.sent2: The child whimpered softly after falling down.
meanings.sent3: The kitten whimpered as if asking for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The wind whimpered through the trees on the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The old floorboards whimpered under the weight of the heavy furniture.

meanings.definition: To complain or protest in a feeble or petulant manner.
meanings.sent1: She whimpered about having to do her chores.
meanings.sent2: He whimpered when he didn't get his favorite dessert.
meanings.sent3: The student whimpered about the difficult homework assignment.
meanings.sent4: The car whimpered as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The toddler whimpered for more candy at the store.
